body:
Separately: Though I'd prefer migrations outside source, handled by a tool,  if aliases _were_ in Go, the main thing on my mind would still be encouraging library users to actually transition to the new canonical names, and making that easy for them. 

I think that means having a tool that will statically resolve aliases, and making `lint` encourage you to run it when it notices you referencing the old names. That still wouldn't be ideal for my "OSS dev who wants to change an API" scenario; no OSS library author can be confident all their users use `lint`, so some users will never find out there was a transition. Still beats not even trying to encourage users to converge on the new API.
